item.title: Molecular Biosciences Interest Group (MBIG) seminar series
item.description:
Molecular Biosciences Interest Group (MBIG) seminar series

Speaker: Dr. Erica Holliday, Kennesaw State University
Title: “Dualities and Disparities in Recovery and Addiction Research: The Case for Ecological Models”

 

The Molecular Biosciences Interdisciplinary Group (MBIG) seminar series highlights work done on a broad range of science such as neurodevelopment, gene regulation, and cancer by scientists using biological approaches that utilize biochemistry, molecular and cell biology, and genetics.  Guest speakers come from local, regional, and national universities to share their research work. The MBIG seminar will take place in-person on Fridays from 12:30 – 1:30 pm in the English Building, room EB 102. All faculty, staff, students, and alumni are invited to attend.

From Friday, September 6, 2024 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM EDT at English Building, room EB 102.

item.title: Applied Mathematics in Industry Seminar
item.description:
Applied Mathematics in Industry Seminar

Speaker: Jake Jian, Director Data Science at 2U
Title: “From Novice to Leader: Navigating Your Career in Data Science”

Abstract: Embarking on a career in data science is like stepping into a world of endless possibilities, where data-driven insights shape industries and innovation knows no bounds. But how do you transform from a novice data scientist into a leader who drives impact at the highest levels? In this presentation, we'll explore the essential steps to advance your career in data science, from mastering the technical skills to building a strong professional network, and from staying ahead of industry trends to developing the soft skills that set leaders apart. Whether you're just starting out or looking to accelerate your growth, this talk will provide practical advice, inspiring examples, and insider tips to help you chart a path to success in the dynamic and ever-evolving field of data science. Join us to learn how to turn your passion for data into a fulfilling and influential career.


Bio: Jake Jian is the Director of Data Science at 2U, where he leads a team to optimize marketing and admissions with advanced AI/ML strategies. Previously, he held senior roles in consulting, including as Data Science Practice Lead at Grid Dynamics and Senior Principal at Infosys. Jake has architected innovative solutions for the Telecommunications, Retail, and Energy sectors,  generating multi-million-dollar revenues. His expertise spans predictive modeling, recommendation systems, and NLP. Additionally, Jake excels in team management, forging strategic partnerships, and translating technical concepts for non-technical audiences, including C-level executives. He holds advanced degrees in Statistics and Economics from Columbia University and Boston College.

 

The Applied Mathematics in Industry Seminar (AMIS) series is primarily focused on highlighting how mathematics is used in various different careers and is geared toward undergraduates. Seminars typically require little or no advanced mathematical knowledge and are open to anyone.

 

This seminar will be held virtually.

DIAL-IN INFORMATION
Stream Link
Passcode: Ami2024

From Friday, September 6, 2024 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: FLIGHT28: First Fridays (Marietta Monster Mini Golf)
item.description:
FLIGHT28: First Fridays (Marietta Monster Mini Golf)

FLIGHT28 is excited to partner with Housing and Residence Life to bring you our “First Friday” evening event for Fall 2024! FLIGHT28 students will be allowed to sign up for a limited number of tickets to Marietta Monster Mini Golf on Friday, September 6th!

Transportation: You may transport yourself to and from the event. However, if you would like to ride BOB for transportation, you will need to meet on campus and follow the BOB route schedule. Please see below for more information on transportation via BOB.

Before signing up, please read the important notes below:

NOTES ON PARTICIPANT RESTRICTIONS: This event is open to all FLIGHT28 students of Kennesaw State University. If you sign up for the event and are unable to attend, you must contact James Stinchcomb jstinch2@kennesaw.edu no later than Wednesday, September 4th, 2024. Failure to attend the event despite signing up with no communication will result in the attendee being charged the full cost of entry. 

Disclaimer for Travel Event Participants

As part of our commitment to ensuring the safety and well-being of all participants, we must inform you of the following important policy regarding the use of university services during this travel event:

Intoxication Policy

For reasons of safety, any student who is visibly inebriated or appears to be in need of care due to alcohol or substance use will not be permitted to utilize university-provided services. This includes, but is not limited to, transportation, medical assistance, and accommodations arranged by the university.

Responsibility Clause

Students are responsible for their own behavior and well-being throughout the duration of the event. We strongly encourage all participants to make responsible choices and to look out for their fellow students. In case of an emergency, participants should seek help from local emergency services immediately.

NOTE FOR BOB (BUS) PICKUP:

Please be sure to use the TransLoc app to verify when your “Kennesaw Shopping” bus will arrive nearest you. Bus Routes and Stops are located here. Please be sure to make note of bus operating times, as the last bus returning to Kennesaw Campus will leave the Walmart shopping area around 5:30 p.m. - and Marietta attendees will need to be sure to make it back to Kennesaw Campus and onto the final bus on the Kennesaw-Marietta route  All attendees are required to return to the bus loading area by 4:45 p.m. for departure by 5 p.m. SHARP - as this will be the final transportation back to the Marietta/Kennesaw campuses.
Attendees who RSVP, "Yes" and receive a confirmed ticket will be able to receive entry at the Marietta Monster Mini-Golf check-in. Please Note, students CAN still be transported to location on the BOB buses and purchase their own entry, if preferred.

 

From Friday, September 6, 2024 12:00 PM to 5:30 PM EDT at Marietta Monster Mini Golf.

item.title: Mike Wiley Presents: Breach of Peace
item.description:
Mike Wiley Presents: Breach of Peace

BREACH OF PEACE is based on true accounts of surviving participants of the Freedom Rides as well as many other individuals involved in the early struggle for African-American equality. This solo-play is a living monument to those remarkable young men and women of various races, religions and backgrounds who rose to face the dangers of fighting for just and equal treatment for all.

item.title: BSTA Fall 2024 Orientation & Dinner
item.description:
BSTA Fall 2024 Orientation & Dinner

Join us for an unforgettable evening as the Bangladeshi Student Association (BSTA) at Kennesaw State University proudly presents the Fall 2024 Bangladesh Student Orientation and Dinner. This annual event is a celebration of the vibrant culture, rich traditions, and warm hospitality of Bangladesh, providing an opportunity for students, faculty, staff, and guests to come together and experience the essence of our heritage.

This cultural night will be filled with an array of activities that showcase the best of Bangladesh. From traditional music and dance performances to captivating presentations about our customs and values, the event promises to be a night of cultural immersion.

Come and be a part of this cultural extravaganza, where we celebrate our roots, share our traditions, and create lasting memories together.

From Friday, September 6, 2024 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM EDT at J.M. Wilson Student Center (Ballroom A&B).

item.title: Gift of Life: Bone Marrow Registry
item.description:
Gift of Life: Bone Marrow Registry

Stop by our table to learn more about the Gift of Life Bone Marrow Registry! If you decide you would like to sign up we will walk you through the super simple registration process. All we need from you is a simple cheek swab, a totally confidential medical questionnaire, and your contact information!

 

Gift of Life works to cure blood cancer through cellular therapy. They build a registry of potential donors to increase the chances that someone afflicted with blood cancer will find a good match. When patients under these conditions require donations it's incredibly hard to find a match. That's because stem cell and marrow donations are more complicated than blood. They require both the donor and recipient to have matching immune system factors, of which there are thousands of possible combinations. Some people never find a match, but the more people who join the registry the greater their chances of receiving a life saving donation become!

 

Join the registry today to save a life!

 

Check out their website if you want to learn more now! 

https://www.giftoflife.org/about/whoweare

From Monday, September 9, 2024 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus Green, Zone 2.

item.title: Discover Recovery
item.description:
Discover Recovery

This is a weekly community and skill building workshop designed to provide support to students in early recovery by enhancing the ability to navigate their collegiate career while also emerging into recovery, build their recovery capital, and learn to develop interpersonal skills. 

Discover Recovery is for any student seeking recovery or is in their first 6 months of recovery. We support students who are in or seeking recovery from substance use disorders, eating disorders, and other process addictions. For more information or directions to the Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery, email recovery@kennesaw.edu

From Monday, September 9, 2024 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6138.

item.title: R.A.D Classes (Women Only)
item.description:
R.A.D Classes (Women Only)

Rape Aggression Defense (R.A.D.) is a simple yet effective self-defense class for women only.

This course consists of a lecture portion, which focuses on Risk Awareness, Risk Reduction, and Risk Avoidance, followed by hands-on tactical training. The techniques taught are designed to be quick and effective in delivering pain to vulnerable locations on the attacker's body. The course is designed such that women of all fitness levels and ages will be successful in learning options to escape attacks.

 

For class information and to register for this class, e-mail radclasses@kennesaw.edu
Please wear clothing appropriate for physical activities (no skirts/dresses or shoes with heels...sneakers are preferable).

From Monday, September 9, 2024 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Campus Public Safety.

item.title: Presidential Debate Night Watch Party
item.description:
Presidential Debate Night Watch Party

Join us for an engaging evening as we watch the upcoming presidential debate together! This watch party isn't just about tuning in—it's about creating a space where we can gather, share food, and discuss the key issues shaping our nation as college students!

Before the debate kicks off, we'll have an informative voter registration session to ensure everyone is ready to cast their vote in the upcoming election. We'll cover everything you need to know about registering, the importance of your vote, and how to stay informed on the issues that matter most to you.

After the debate, we'll open the floor for a conversation about what we've heard. This is a chance to express how the candidates' views resonate with us, discuss our thoughts, and consider how their platforms align with our values.

What to Expect:

  • Free Food: Enjoy snacks and refreshments throughout the evening.
  • Voter Registration Info: Get all the details you need to register or update your voter information.
  • Pre- and Post-Debate Conversations: Share your thoughts and hear from others in a respectful and open dialogue.

Come for the debate, stay for the conversation—your voice matters!

From Tuesday, September 10, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EDT at Social Science Building Room 1021.

item.title: OSHA 10hr Training
item.description:
OSHA 10hr Training

The Outreach Training Program is a voluntary program. Its purpose is to promote workplace safety and health and to make workers more knowledgeable about workplace hazards and their rights. Outreach training does not fulfill the training requirements found in OSHA standards. Employers are responsible for providing additional training for their workers on specific hazards of their job as noted in many OSHA standards. The OSHA Outreach Training Program provides training on the recognition, avoidance, abatement, and prevention of workplace hazards. Outreach classes also provide overview information regarding OSHA, including workers' rights, employer responsibilities, and how to file a complaint.

Program Benefits

  • Promotes safety culture through peer training.
  • Training is intended to be participatory, using hands-on activities.
  • Trainers can tailor the training topics based on the specific needs of their audience.
  • Outreach training content includes hazard recognition and avoidance, workers' rights, employer responsibilities, and how to file a complaint; it emphasizes the value of safety and health to workers, including young workers.

 

Training will be held in the Joe Mack Wilson Student Center - Room A216

From Tuesday, September 10, 2024 8:00 AM to Wednesday, September 11, 2024 3:00 PM EDT at Joe Mack Wilson Student Center.

item.title: Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)
item.description:
Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery now hosts an on-campus Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA - formerly known as Self-Injury Recovery Anonymous) meeting. This Meeting of SIRA is for people in recovery or seeking recovery. This group is not open to observation or academic credit.

To provide a safe space for individuals who engage in physical self-injury to come together to share experiences, strength, and hope without judgment or criticism. Together, we deepen our understanding of our behaviors and triggers and work within the framework of our program to help ourselves and each other on our path to freedom. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop injuring oneself physically.

From Wednesday, September 11, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6138.

item.title: R.A.D Classes (Women Only)
item.description:
R.A.D Classes (Women Only)

Rape Aggression Defense (R.A.D.) is a simple yet effective self-defense class for women only.

This course consists of a lecture portion, which focuses on Risk Awareness, Risk Reduction, and Risk Avoidance, followed by hands-on tactical training. The techniques taught are designed to be quick and effective in delivering pain to vulnerable locations on the attacker's body. The course is designed such that women of all fitness levels and ages will be successful in learning options to escape attacks.

 

For class information and to register for this class, e-mail radclasses@kennesaw.edu
Please wear clothing appropriate for physical activities (no skirts/dresses or shoes with heels...sneakers are preferable).

From Wednesday, September 11, 2024 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Campus Public Safety.

item.title: Ecology, Evolution, Behavior, & Organismal Biology (EEBOB) seminar series
item.description:
Ecology, Evolution, Behavior, & Organismal Biology (EEBOB) seminar series

Speaker: Dr. Roani Rebouças, Postdoctoral Researcher at University of Campinas
Title: “Islands, frogs, and illustrations”
Abstract:  Dr. Roani Rebouças is a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Campinas (Brazil), and today, he arrives for a ~ two-month visit in our lab. Dr. Rebouças' academic research focuses on amphibian ecology, and he also works as a professional scientific illustrator. For example, check out Dr. Rebouças' original "Papo de Sapo" (i.e., "Frog Talk") cartoon series focused on science communication. This seminar it describes both his scientific work on island-dwelling frogs in Brazil (i.e., island gigantism and island biogeography) and his career as an illustrator. Also, please come find Dr. Rebouças in the Pierson lab (SL 4050) to say hello during these next couple of months!

 

The Ecology, Evolution, Behavior, & Organismal Biology (EEBOB) seminar series focuses on biological topics at whole-organism and higher scales of organization. Guest speakers come from universities, governmental agencies, NGOs, zoos, museums, and other institutions.

 

This seminar series consists of a pre-recorded seminar, which will be posted to a playlist at the beginning of each week, and a live, virtual Q&A session with the speaker. All are welcome to attend! For access to the live Q&A session, interested attendees can email Dr. Todd Pierson to be granted access. The live Q&A session will be held each Thursday @ 9:30 AM.

From Thursday, September 12, 2024 9:30 AM to 10:30 AM EDT at Online.

item.title: 2024 Fall Accounting, Finance, & Fintech Job & Internship Fair
item.description:
2024 Fall Accounting, Finance, & Fintech Job & Internship Fair

Each Fall semester, we invite many of the nation's top employers and organizations to the Kennesaw campus in order to showcase KSU's brightest students and alumni for internships, full-time, & part-time positions.

 

Companies will be primarily hiring for roles in  accounting, finance, fintech, and other similar areas. Companies are also recruiting for several other majors and positions. Students of all majors and class levels are encouraged to attend.

Please Note: Business Casual to Business Professional dress and student ID are required for entry.  Bring plenty of copies of your resume to give to employers!

This fair will be held in person and many companies are recruiting virtually - check Handshake for virtual employer events.

Visit https://www.kennesaw.edu/careers/job-fairs/index.php for more information and tips to best prepare for the fair! And don't forget to download the Handshake App (free download for Apple and Android devices) to RSVP for the fair, receive notifications and reminders, and see the list of registered employers for the upcoming Job, Internship, and Co-op Fairs! You can favorite the Employers you want to visit to make it easier to find them on the day of the event.

BUSA students participating in this session may obtain credit for their course. There is no QR code for this event. Attendance will be recorded (see "Suitable" app for details).

From Thursday, September 12, 2024 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM EDT at KSU Center.

item.title: Virtual Artist Lecture: Didi Dunphy
item.description:
Virtual Artist Lecture: Didi Dunphy

Didi Dunphy is the juror for the Art Educators Biennial on view in the Fine Arts Gallery at KSU from September 3 to October 4, 2024. Dunphy will discuss her artistic practice and her most recent exhibition that was installed at Whitespace in Atlanta. Didi Dunphy is currently the Program Supervisor at the Lyndon House Arts Center, a civic arts campus dedicated to incorporating visual art and arts education with the mission of enriching the community of Athens GA, and beyond. Dunphy is a former Visiting Scholar and Professor in contemporary and digital media arts at the Lamar Dodd School of Art, UGA, who works as an independent curator in partnership with regional art museums. Her current program, Highlighting Contemporary Art in Georgia: Picture This is traveling throughout the state.  

From Thursday, September 12, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Wise Choices Workshop
item.description:
Wise Choices Workshop

Designed to educate students in making informed choices about drugs and alcohol, this course is taught on referral from multiple sources; including Student Conduct & Academic Integrity, Department of Fraternity & Sorority Life, Housing & Residence Life, and Department of Athletics. This three-hour workshop is taught by the Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery staff specializing in the field of addiction prevention and education. 


Students who participate in the Wise Choices Workshop will be charged an administrative fee for this class. Your Owl Express account will be assessed the amount of $85.00 after completion of the workshop. This fee must be paid within 30 days to avoid a Bursar's registration hold on your account. You may pay this fee on-line through Owl Express (web-check or credit card) or in person at the Bursar's Office (cash, check or money order). Please wait until you have received an email notification that the charge has been posted before you attempt to pay.

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery (CYAAR) is looking for Ambassadors to participate in Alcohol and Other Drug Prevention and Education initiatives across campus! Ambassadors will provide a service to the campus community by educating students through CYAAR programming and collaborating on events. Ambassadors will receive Recovery Ally Training as well as training in representing CYAAR across campus. Ambassadors will not only be campus influencers, but can also receive volunteer hours through Give Pulse. Ambassadors will meet once a month after training to plan upcoming events and programs. RSVP is required for training.

item.title: OwlsServe Day at the International Rescue Committee
item.description:
OwlsServe Day at the International Rescue Committee

Join the Department of Student Volunteerism & Service for a day of service on Saturday, September 14th, from 9am to 1pm with International Rescue Committee (IRC). Volunteers will assist with donation sorting and hygiene kit packing at the Welcome-Co-op, a partner organization of IRC. 

Registration Information: Each student must register for this event on GivePulse. Registration is required to participate. Lunch will be provided. Please note any dietary restrictions or food allergies in your registration form. https://kennesaw.givepulse.com/event/461960-irc-owlsserve-day

Transportation: Transportation will be provided. All students are required to ride the SVS Big Owl Bus to and from campus.

Registration Deadline: The registration deadline is September 9th. There are no opportunities for walk-up registration.

Communications: Full details about the IRC OwlsServe Day will be sent to all registered participants on September 9th. If you have any questions in the meantime, please email ksuserves@kennesaw.edu.

SVS is committed to providing accessible programming for all students. Please indicate any accommodations you need to participate in this event when registering.

From Saturday, September 14, 2024 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM EDT at International Rescue Committee Atlanta.

item.description:

Always waiting to the last minute to start an assignment? Waiting so long to start you turn in bad work? This workshop discusses the procrastination cycle, strategies for breaking it, tips for keeping it from restarting. 

Learn strategies for organizing your day and making the most use of your time. Planners, Goal Setting, Prioritizing Tasks, Time Wasters and more will be discussed along with examples of effective uses.

item.title: Discover Recovery
item.description:
Discover Recovery

This is a weekly community and skill building workshop designed to provide support to students in early recovery by enhancing the ability to navigate their collegiate career while also emerging into recovery, build their recovery capital, and learn to develop interpersonal skills. 

Discover Recovery is for any student seeking recovery or is in their first 6 months of recovery. We support students who are in or seeking recovery from substance use disorders, eating disorders, and other process addictions. For more information or directions to the Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery, email recovery@kennesaw.edu

From Monday, September 16, 2024 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6138.

item.title: BodyPositiveKSU Book Club (BI)
item.description:
BodyPositiveKSU Book Club (BI)

College can present additional challenges for people experiencing eating and body image issues. Join a KSU dietitian, therapist, and peer counselor for a biweekly book club about body image topics. We will discuss sections of the book and build community while creating a body positive campus. 

 

We will read two books this semester; the discussion schedule is below. Please email Danielle Southern at dsouth13@kennesaw.edu if you have any questions or would like to rent a copy of the book

 

Embody by Connie Sobczak:

9/16: Intro/Welcome, Competency 1-2 
9/30: Competency 3-5

 

Reclaiming Body Trust by Hilary Kinavey and Dana Sturtevant:

10/14: Intro, Part 1 
10/28: Part 2 
11/11: Part 3

From Monday, September 16, 2024 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM EDT at Student Recreation and Activities Center Suite 1220.

item.title: R.A.D Classes (Women Only)
item.description:
R.A.D Classes (Women Only)

Rape Aggression Defense (R.A.D.) is a simple yet effective self-defense class for women only.

This course consists of a lecture portion, which focuses on Risk Awareness, Risk Reduction, and Risk Avoidance, followed by hands-on tactical training. The techniques taught are designed to be quick and effective in delivering pain to vulnerable locations on the attacker's body. The course is designed such that women of all fitness levels and ages will be successful in learning options to escape attacks.

 

For class information and to register for this class, e-mail radclasses@kennesaw.edu
Please wear clothing appropriate for physical activities (no skirts/dresses or shoes with heels...sneakers are preferable).

From Monday, September 16, 2024 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Campus Public Safety.

item.description:
Managing Anxiety & Depression

The Managing Anxiety and Depression virtual workshop will be an educational experience with the opportunity to interact with counselor and group members going through similar struggles. Not a therapy group but designed to begin providing you with knowledge in the healing process, awareness about your mood and to begin practicing these skills on your own. We aim to help you understand:

  • Causes and experiences of anxiety and depression
  • Connection between stress and anxiety/depression
  • New approaches to managing anxiety and depression
  • How the mind and body respond to mental distress
The workshop will be hosted virtually on Microsoft Teams. Students who RSVP thru OwlLife will receive a meeting invitation on the day of the workshop. 

From Tuesday, September 17, 2024 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: QPR Training
item.description:
QPR Training
QPR (Question, Persuade, Refer) are three simple steps anyone can learn to help save a life from suicide. People trained in QPR learn how to recognize the warning signs of a suicide crisis and how to question, persuade, and refer someone to help. 


The in-person training will be held on the Kennesaw campus. REGISTER by completing the form, Fall 2024 Mental Health Training Registration. Please register no later than one week before the training date. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Chelsea Williams at cwill733@kennesaw.edu. 

 

If your group or department is interested in hosting an in-person training on either campus, please reach out to Chelsea Williams at cwill733@kennesaw.edu for more information.  

From Wednesday, September 18, 2024 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM EDT at Academic Learning Center.

item.title: Dining in the Nest - Kennesaw Campus
item.description:
Dining in the Nest - Kennesaw Campus
Have you wanted to make new friends but feel anxious or have a hard time finding your community? Have you been stressed out about going to the Commons or Stingers?  Then this is the event for you! We invite you to join the CPS Peer Counselors for lunch! No Meal Plan necessary. Space is LIMITED so please RSVP.
 
For the Kennesaw campus events, students will meet over in the WellNest (Carmichael Student Ctr, room 261) at 11:45am. We will walk over to the Commons together.
 
There will be a 5-minute grace period for students to arrive for this event at the meeting locations. Please arrive during this time, as the event will begin promptly. Students who arrive after will not be able to attend.
 
If you cannot attend the event after submitting your RSVP, please cancel your reservation to allow other students to participate.
Maximum 2 sign ups per student.  
 
We look forward to dining with you!

From Wednesday, September 18, 2024 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus, Meet in the WellNest (Carmichael Student Ctr, room 261) .

item.title: Naloxone Training Session for Graduate Students
item.description:
Naloxone Training Session for Graduate Students

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery will host a naloxone training session that will teach graduate students how to administer naloxone, the medication that can reverse the effects of an opioid overdose.

Training is free for KSU graduate students. Each person who attends and completes the training will be given a free Naloxone kit. Sign-up is required.

At the end of this training, the participants will be able to:
- Identify potential warning signs of an overdose
- Operate and administer Naloxone in the event of an overdose
- Identify how Naloxone works
- Understand the Georgia Medical Amnesty Law

From Wednesday, September 18, 2024 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM EDT at Academic Learning Center, Room ALC3550.

item.title: Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)
item.description:
Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery now hosts an on-campus Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA - formerly known as Self-Injury Recovery Anonymous) meeting. This Meeting of SIRA is for people in recovery or seeking recovery. This group is not open to observation or academic credit.

To provide a safe space for individuals who engage in physical self-injury to come together to share experiences, strength, and hope without judgment or criticism. Together, we deepen our understanding of our behaviors and triggers and work within the framework of our program to help ourselves and each other on our path to freedom. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop injuring oneself physically.

From Wednesday, September 18, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6138.

item.title: R.A.D Classes (Women Only)
item.description:
R.A.D Classes (Women Only)

Rape Aggression Defense (R.A.D.) is a simple yet effective self-defense class for women only.

This course consists of a lecture portion, which focuses on Risk Awareness, Risk Reduction, and Risk Avoidance, followed by hands-on tactical training. The techniques taught are designed to be quick and effective in delivering pain to vulnerable locations on the attacker's body. The course is designed such that women of all fitness levels and ages will be successful in learning options to escape attacks.

 

For class information and to register for this class, e-mail radclasses@kennesaw.edu
Please wear clothing appropriate for physical activities (no skirts/dresses or shoes with heels...sneakers are preferable).

From Wednesday, September 18, 2024 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Campus Public Safety.

item.description:
Ecology, Evolution, Behavior, & Organismal Biology (EEBOB) seminar series

Speaker: Bob Kuhn, Biotechnology Teacher at Innovation Academy
Title: “TBA”
Abstract: TBA

 

The Ecology, Evolution, Behavior, & Organismal Biology (EEBOB) seminar series focuses on biological topics at whole-organism and higher scales of organization. Guest speakers come from universities, governmental agencies, NGOs, zoos, museums, and other institutions.

 

This seminar series consists of a pre-recorded seminar, which will be posted to a playlist at the beginning of each week, and a live, virtual Q&A session with the speaker. All are welcome to attend! For access to the live Q&A session, interested attendees can email Dr. Todd Pierson to be granted access. The live Q&A session will be held each Thursday @ 9:30 AM.

item.description:
We the People: The Documents That Made Our Nation

Join us for this signature Constitution Week event where students, faculty, and staff will enjoy the newly restored Declaration of Independence; the new We the People traveling exhibit; rare books, documents, and artifacts from that time period; calligraphy station; Constitution trivia; snacks and game, selfie station with founding fathers, videos with James & Dolly Madison; and themed giveaways.

From Thursday, September 19, 2024 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM EDT at Sturgis Library.

item.title: LIL Bites: Pages of Change: Zine Leadership Workshop (Kennesaw)
item.description:
LIL Bites: Pages of Change: Zine Leadership Workshop (Kennesaw)

Join us for our monthly "LIL Bites" series at the Leadership Hub, where tiny yet impactful activities are designed to nurture your leadership skills. Plus, savor the delightful treat of Little Bites muffins while you engage in each session! 

This LIL Bites is part of the 2024 Constitution Week. Join us for a creative activity centered around ‘zine making! Participants will craft their own ‘zines, exploring themes of community, advocacy, and personal expression. Materials will be provided for you to create your 'zine.

The LIL Bites are based on the Leap into Leadership (LIL) Endorsement series by the Department of Student Leadership. Learn more about the endorsement series here: https://www.kennesaw.edu/student-affairs/involvement/student-leadership/leadership-development.php. 

This is a drop-in-style event. Your attendance is not required for the entire duration of the event. Activities are self-paced. 

 

From Thursday, September 19, 2024 11:00 AM to 2:00 PM EDT at Carmichael Student Center - Suite 267.

item.title: Naloxone Training
item.description:
Naloxone Training

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery will host training sessions throughout each semester to teach students how to administer Naloxone, a medication that reverses the effects of an opioid overdose.

At the end of this training the participants will be able to:

  1. Identify potential warning signs of an overdose
  2. Operate and administer Naloxone in the event of an overdose
  3. Identify how Naloxone works
  4. Understand the Georgia Medical Amnesty Law
  5. Practice with Naloxone test kits

Each person who attends & completes training is provided a free Naloxone kit. RSVP is required for training.

From Friday, September 20, 2024 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM EDT at Marietta Campus - JM Wilson Student Center - A216.

item.title: Power Query in Excel
item.description:
Power Query in Excel
Power Query is a data transformation and data preparation engine. Learn how to import or connect to external data, and then shape that data (i.e., remove a column, change a data type, or merge tables) in ways that meet your needs. Then, you can load your query into Excel to create charts and reports. Join this workshop and optimize your data workflow!
 
 

To register for this course, follow the steps below:

 

1. Click here to navigate to this course in OwlTrain.

item.description:
Constitution Week 2024: Women's Voices for Civil Rights

Presented by The Museum of History and Holocaust Education and funded by a 2021 grant from the Breman Foundation of Atlanta, this eight-panel traveling exhibit, Women's Voices for Civil Rights, honors the enduring contributions of women and girls in the struggle for civil rights in the United States. Featuring profiles of historic and contemporary activists, the exhibit provides valuable context and definitions for students and educators.

Join us for this inspiring exploration as part of our Constitution Week activities.

item.title: ArtsKSU Presents: Stephanie Blythe, Mezzo-Soprano & Ryan McCullough, Piano "Mister In-between: The Music of Johnny Mercer"
item.description:
ArtsKSU Presents: Stephanie Blythe, Mezzo-Soprano & Ryan McCullough, Piano "Mister In-between: The Music of Johnny Mercer"

ArtsKSU Series. A celebrated opera singer, recitalist, and cabaret artist, mezzo-soprano Stephanie Blythe is one of the most highly respected and critically acclaimed artists of her generation. Her repertoire ranges from Handel to Wagner, German lieder to contemporary and classic American song. Ms. Blythe has performed on many of the world's great stages, such as Carnegie Hall, the Metropolitan Opera, Covent Garden, Paris National Opera and San Francisco, Chicago Lyric and Seattle Operas. In 2009, Ms. Blythe was named Musical America’s Vocalist of the Year.

From Friday, September 20, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EDT at Morgan Hall.

Transportation: Transportation will be provided on both the Marietta and Kennesaw Campus. All students will be required to ride the SVS Big Owl Bus to and from campus.

Registration Deadline: The registration deadline is September 16th at 11am. There are no opportunities for walk-up registration.

item.title: Operation Caudle Home Ramp Project
item.description:
Operation Caudle Home Ramp Project

Need Volunteers!

Russel Caudle is a disabled Veteran who served over 20 years in the United States Air Force. He enlisted in 1954 after graduating from high school and served in numerous positions and Military specialties during his 22 year career. In 1967 he was assigned to the 321st Graphics Shop in Vietnam where he supported Gen William Westmorland and other Generals with situation maps. He retired with the rank of Master Sargent, and now lives in Acworth with his wife. 

Project:

A ramp has already been built, it just needs to be stained. We are looking for volunteers to help with the staining process. This will take place on Sept 21st 9:00-12:00.

Location:

6500 Will Dupree Lane Acworth, GA 30102

Owl Bus Transportation Provided from Kennesaw Campus

Sept 21 9:00-12:00

*A link to sign up will be provided soon*

From Saturday, September 21, 2024 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM EDT at Russel Caudle's Home.

ChoreoLab

Join us for a unique and immersive dance performance presented by the talented student choreographers and dancers from the KSU Dance Department. This event offers an opportunity to experience site-specific dance, where the choreography is designed to interact with the architecture and environment of the venue, creating a dynamic and intimate connection between the performers, the audience, and the space. item.title: Recovery Symposium
item.description:
Recovery Symposium

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery will be hosting a drop-in event during National Recovery Month in September for students, faculty, and staff to learn more about recovery support at Kennesaw State University. If you have ever had any questions about recovery support, mutual aid meetings, the collegiate recovery program, or how to support someone you care about, this is an event you don't want to miss. Talk to students and staff in recovery and our recovery allies to learn more about anything you ever wondered about. Licensed dieticians from Health Promotion and Wellness will also be available to answer questions about nutrition support and eating disorder recovery. We will also have snacks and activities!

From Monday, September 23, 2024 12:00 PM to 3:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus - Carmichael Student Center - University Room C.

Discover Recovery is for any student seeking recovery or is in their first 6 months of recovery. We support students who are in or seeking recovery from substance use disorders, eating disorders, and other process addictions. For more information or directions to the Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery, email recovery@kennesaw.edu

item.title: 2024 Fall STEM Job, Co-op, & Internship Fair
item.description:
2024 Fall STEM Job, Co-op, & Internship Fair

Each Fall & Spring semester, we invite many of the nation's top companies to the Marietta campus in order to showcase KSU's brightest students and alumni for internship, co-op, full-time, & part-time positions.

Companies will be primarily hiring for roles in STEM-related fields and jobs. Don't forget that this is a three-day fair, so be sure to look for which day each company will be in attendance, and make plans to attend multiple days to visit with more companies!

 

  • Day 1 - Computer Technology, Math, Data, and Engineering
  • Day 2 - Architecture, Construction, and Structural Design and Engineering
  • Day 3 - Engineering

 

Many companies are also hiring for roles in accounting, management, communications, and many more fields. Students of all majors and class levels are encouraged to attend.

Please Note: Business Casual to Business Professional dress and student ID are required for entry. Bring plenty of copies of your resume to give to employers!

This fair will be held in person and many companies are recruiting virtually - check Handshake for virtual employer events.

Visit https://www.kennesaw.edu/careers/job-fairs/index.php for more information and tips to best prepare for the fair! And don't forget to download the Handshake App (free download for Apple and Android devices) to RSVP for the fair, receive notifications and reminders, and see the list of registered employers for the upcoming Job, Internship, and Co-op Fairs! You can favorite the Employers you want to visit to make it easier to find them on the day of the event.

BUSA students participating in this session may obtain credit for their course. There is no QR code for this event. Attendance will be recorded (see "Suitable" app for details).

From Tuesday, September 24, 2024 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: #ISENG Speaker Series: Rafal Los
item.description:
#ISENG Speaker Series: Rafal Los
Rafal Los is an industry innovator, strategist, and personality. His career spans 20+ years while working inside companies from the Fortune 10 to a firm of less than 10. Rafal's strengths include strategic leadership, developing and refining market strategies, business process optimization, and bringing people together to solve complex problems. Most recent achievements include assisting a company in its pivot from infrastructure provider to security-as-a-service by developing a pre-sales strategy and developing a professional services framework; implementing significant changes in business process that led to the company's ability to measure the impacts of various efforts on the sales cycle.

Rafal is an active member of the Security Advisor Alliance, serving on the advisory board with the intent of creating innovative ways for security leaders to give back to their communities through service and knowledge sharing.

Additionally, Rafal is a founder and host of the Down the Security Rabbithole Podcast - an industry podcast delivering a weekly office-friendly format since 2011. The podcast includes thought leadership, and industry experts from government advisors, industry founders, and everyone in between.

Rafal's career is about more than being a recognizable expert - he brings people together to solve complex problems in innovative ways; forming relationships and continually sharing his hunger for knowledge.

In this session, he will be discussing risk management.

From Tuesday, September 24, 2024 5:00 PM to 6:15 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus, Academic Learning Center - 3201.

item.title: Intro to CAISY AI Simulator
item.description:
Intro to CAISY AI Simulator

This workshop introduces learners to CAISY. CAISY provides interactive, scenario-based content powered by AI where a learner can practice new skills in a safe space. This AI simulation content allows learners to choose a role and practice specific skills by responding to AI prompts. The CAISY AI simulator rates your responses as if it were a HR representative employing best practices for the given situation.

 

To register for this course, follow the steps below:

 

1. Click here to navigate to this course in OwlTrain.
2. Scroll down to browse available dates/times for this course.
3. When you find the date/time that you would like to attend, click the Register button on the right side of the page.
4. You have successfully registered for this course! You will receive a reminder email 48 hours before the course starts.
5. To join the course when it starts, click the View Live Course button in either your email or on the OwlTrain course page.

From Wednesday, September 25, 2024 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: 2024 Fall STEM Job, Co-op, & Internship Fair
item.description:
2024 Fall STEM Job, Co-op, & Internship Fair

Each Fall & Spring semester, we invite many of the nation's top companies to the Marietta campus in order to showcase KSU's brightest students and alumni for internship, co-op, full-time, & part-time positions.

Companies will be primarily hiring for roles in STEM-related fields and jobs. Don't forget that this is a three-day fair, so be sure to look for which day each company will be in attendance, and make plans to attend multiple days to visit with more companies!

 

  • Day 1 - Computer Technology, Math, Data, and Engineering
  • Day 2 - Architecture, Construction, and Structural Design and Engineering
  • Day 3 - Engineering

 

Many companies are also hiring for roles in accounting, management, communications, and many more fields. Students of all majors and class levels are encouraged to attend.

Please Note: Business Casual to Business Professional dress and student ID are required for entry. Bring plenty of copies of your resume to give to employers!

This fair will be held in person and many companies are recruiting virtually - check Handshake for virtual employer events.

Visit https://www.kennesaw.edu/careers/job-fairs/index.php for more information and tips to best prepare for the fair! And don't forget to download the Handshake App (free download for Apple and Android devices) to RSVP for the fair, receive notifications and reminders, and see the list of registered employers for the upcoming Job, Internship, and Co-op Fairs! You can favorite the Employers you want to visit to make it easier to find them on the day of the event.

BUSA students participating in this session may obtain credit for their course. There is no QR code for this event. Attendance will be recorded (see "Suitable" app for details).

From Wednesday, September 25, 2024 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)
item.description:
Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery now hosts an on-campus Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA - formerly known as Self-Injury Recovery Anonymous) meeting. This Meeting of SIRA is for people in recovery or seeking recovery. This group is not open to observation or academic credit.

To provide a safe space for individuals who engage in physical self-injury to come together to share experiences, strength, and hope without judgment or criticism. Together, we deepen our understanding of our behaviors and triggers and work within the framework of our program to help ourselves and each other on our path to freedom. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop injuring oneself physically.

From Wednesday, September 25, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6138.

Title: “TBA”

The Ecology, Evolution, Behavior, & Organismal Biology (EEBOB) seminar series focuses on biological topics at whole-organism and higher scales of organization. Guest speakers come from universities, governmental agencies, NGOs, zoos, museums, and other institutions.

 

This seminar series consists of a pre-recorded seminar, which will be posted to a playlist at the beginning of each week, and a live, virtual Q&A session with the speaker. All are welcome to attend! item.title: Year of Canada: Money Moves in Canada
item.description:
Year of Canada: Money Moves in Canada

How do citizens influence the support of sports, including the Olympics and the athletes who represent their countries? Hear the results of research on Canadians WTP (Willingness To Pay) that was conducted as part of previous Olympic Games. Better understand how these mindsets can impact athletes, economics, and policies.

Sponsored by the Bagwell Center for the Study of Markets and Economic Opportunity and Global Education. Hosted by Professor of Economics Dr. Timothy Mathews.

This event is part of KSU's focus in 2024-25 on Canada's history, culture, geography, people, and practices. Unique "Year of Canada" merch will be available! Check out all of our events listed in OwlLife and online.

From Thursday, September 26, 2024 9:30 AM to 10:45 AM EDT at Carmichael Student Center, University Rooms B&C.

item.title: Learn About Sustainable Palm Oil
item.description:
Learn About Sustainable Palm Oil

Palm oil is in about 1/2 of all grocery store items. It can be farmed sustainably, but more often than not it isn't. The unsustainable farming of palm oil leads to habitat loss for many endangered species (like orangutans and Sumatran tigers) and harms locals. Despite this, many companies continue to source palm oil in this manner.

Stop by our booth to learn more about the Roundtable of Sustainable Palm Oil and what you can do to advocate for sustainable palm oil!

From Thursday, September 26, 2024 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM EDT at Outdoor info table in front of the Science Building.

You can favorite the Employers you want to visit to make it easier to find them on the day of the event.

BUSA students participating in this session may obtain credit for their course. There is no QR code for this event. Attendance will be recorded (see "Suitable" app for details).

From Thursday, September 26, 2024 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Beacon Book Lecture Series - Why Not Win? by Larry Thornton
item.description:
Beacon Book Lecture Series - Why Not Win? by Larry Thornton

Come hear from renown author Larry Thornton on his famous book "Why Not Win?". This intimate chat with a Q&A section from the audience will cover topics in the book from Larry's own life such as desegregation in the south, becoming a board member for Coca Cola and becoming the first black owner of a McDonalds franchise in Alabama. The first students who show up will receive a free copy of Larry's book. In addition, the Honors College is raffling off a brand new Kindle Paper White and Owala water bottle for the event. Attendance earns you an entry for the raffle. Can't wait to see you there!

From Thursday, September 26, 2024 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM EDT at Convocation Center - Classroom CC2007 (104).

item.title: Start SMART. Stay SMART. Workshop Series - Study Skills/Anxiety
item.description:
Start SMART. Stay SMART. Workshop Series - Study Skills/Anxiety

This workshop will help you learn different strategies for studying and preparing for your courses. Environmental Properties, Effective Note Taking, Collaboration, Reading Comprehension Strategies will all be discussed and effective examples given.

Taking exams can be a stressful experience. Many of us experience increased anxiety in the run up to an exam, during an exam time, as well after the exam is finished. This workshop will discuss types of test anxiety and provide tools for combatting it before, during, and after an exam. 

From Friday, September 27, 2024 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Molecular Biosciences Interest Group (MBIG) seminar series
item.description:
Molecular Biosciences Interest Group (MBIG) seminar series

Speaker: Dr. Nathan McDonald, Georgia Institute of Technology
Title: “Biomolecular condensates organize synapse development”

 

The Molecular Biosciences Interdisciplinary Group (MBIG) seminar series highlights work done on a broad range of science such as neurodevelopment, gene regulation, and cancer by scientists using biological approaches that utilize biochemistry, molecular and cell biology, and genetics.  Guest speakers come from local, regional, and national universities to share their research work. The MBIG seminar will take place in-person on Fridays from 12:30 – 1:30 pm in the English Building, room EB 102. All faculty, staff, students, and alumni are invited to attend.

From Friday, September 20, 2024 12:30 PM to Friday, September 27, 2024 1:30 PM EDT at English Building, room EB 102.

item.title: Year of Canada: Read, Listen, Tell
item.description:
Year of Canada: Read, Listen, Tell

KSU's "Topics in Native American Literature" course will host three editors of the book "Read, Listen, Tell."  The editors are faculty from Canada's Simon Fraser University. They will provide insights and lead discussion on this compilation of unique writings.

"Don’t say in the years to come that you would have lived your life differently if only you had heard this story. You’ve heard it now.” —Thomas King, in this volume

Sponsored by the Norman J. Radow College of Humanities and Social Sciences and Global Education. Hosted by Associate Professor of English and American Studies Dr. Miriam Brown Spiers and Senior Lecturer of English Dr. Rochelle Harris Cox. 

This event is part of KSU's focus in 2024-25 on Canada's history, culture, geography, people, and practices. Unique "Year of Canada" merch will be available! Check out all of our events listed in OwlLife and online.

From Friday, September 27, 2024 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Stomp Out Violence Step Show & Fundraiser
item.description:
Stomp Out Violence Step Show & Fundraiser

Come join us for our 2nd Annual Stomp Out Violence Step Show and Fundraiser! 

 

SAFE Center, Multicultural Greek Council (MGC), and National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) are partnering to bring our KSU community a homecoming week step show and fundraiser to raise awareness about domestic/dating violence. All proceeds will go to SAFE Center to help support their mission in helping students, faculty and staff who are victims of crime. The MGC or NPHC organization who participates in the step show and raises the most money will be the named the 2024 Stomp Out Violence Step Show Winner. The show will be dedicated to Alasia Franklin. 

 

Come out, support the cause, and enjoy the show! 

From Friday, September 27, 2024 7:00 PM to 10:00 PM EDT at Austin Complex Residence Amphitheater .

item.title: "How are you creative?" : CCSE Ideathon Fall 2024
item.description:
"How are you creative?" : CCSE Ideathon Fall 2024

Love Hackathons? Want to learn how to find creative solutions for crazy problems? Join us for the fun and creative Ideathon event hosted by College Of Computing and Software Engineering. Participate in a fun workshop by Professor Kevin D. Gecowets to help unleashing your creativity.

Less coding, more creativity and collaboration. Not a computing major? We embrace diversity! Use this chance to team up with CCSE students and come up with something awesome!

Food will be served both days! Networking, teamwork and monetary prizes for the winners are waiting. 

Event agenda:

Friday 27 Sep 2024:

4:30-5:30 pm: Student  and sponsors check-in

5-6pm: Dinner 

5:30-6:00 pm: Official kickoff. Challenges are presented

6:00-7:00 pm: "How are you creative?" - fun activity led by professor Gecowets

7:00-8:30pm: networking, team formation, brainstorming

Saturday 28 Sep 2024:

8:00 am – students officially declare their teams in the system and choose their pitch time slot

11:00 am – Brunch is served 

12:00 pm – 5:30 pm - Mentorship sessions with guests, faculty and sponsors. 

3:00 pm: Students prepare to pitch their solutions to challenge sponsors/finish their solutions.  

4:30pm-6:30 pm: Student teams pitch their solutions to their Challenge Sponsor judges 

6:00-6:30 Dinner is served

6:30-7:15 pm: Awards Ceremony

7:15 – 7:45 picture opportunities for students and sponsors

 

From Friday, September 27, 2024 4:00 PM to Saturday, September 28, 2024 8:00 PM EDT at Joe Mack Wilson Student Center.

item.title: BodyPositiveKSU Book Club (BI)
item.description:
BodyPositiveKSU Book Club (BI)

College can present additional challenges for people experiencing eating and body image issues. Join a KSU dietitian, therapist, and peer counselor for a biweekly book club about body image topics. We will discuss sections of the book and build community while creating a body positive campus. 

 

We will read two books this semester; the discussion schedule is below. Please email Danielle Southern at dsouth13@kennesaw.edu if you have any questions or would like to rent a copy of the book

 

Embody by Connie Sobczak

9/16: Intro, Competency 1-2 
9/30: Competency 3-5

 

Reclaiming Body Trust by Hilary Kinavey and Dana Sturtevant

10/14: Intro, Part 1 
10/28: Part 2 
11/11: Part 3

From Monday, September 30, 2024 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM EDT at Student Recreation and Activities Center Suite 1220.

Flock Together: Becoming Allies for Recovery is a 75-minute workshop designed for students who are interested in understanding substance use and supporting those in recovery. item.title: Wellstar In Motion Wellness Fair
item.description:
Wellstar In Motion Wellness Fair

The Wellstar In Motion-Wellness Fair, part of the Transforming Lives Discussion Series, is scheduled for Oct 1 from 11-1pm in the Indoor plaza and Outdoor patio.

The vision of the Wellness Fair is to transform lives through high impact engagement and partnering across campus to develop solutions for health and human services for the wellness needs of our college.

The mission for the Wellness Fair is to focus on over-all wellness, fitness, nutrition and mental and physical health for faculty, staff, and students.

The goal of the Wellness Fair is to pull resources from across campus to help us become better champions of health and wellness and foster a more inclusive environment across campus.

By increasing participation in sports and wellness activities, we can address issues that are so important for a well-balanced life at school, work, and home.

From Tuesday, October 1, 2024 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM EDT at Prillaman Hall-Indoor Plaza HS1001.

item.title: Dining in the Nest - Kennesaw Campus
item.description:
Dining in the Nest - Kennesaw Campus
Have you wanted to make new friends but feel anxious or have a hard time finding your community? Have you been stressed out about going to the Commons or Stingers?  Then this is the event for you! We invite you to join the CPS Peer Counselors for lunch! No Meal Plan necessary. Space is LIMITED so please RSVP.
 
For the Kennesaw campus events, students will meet over in the WellNest (Carmichael Student Ctr, room 261) at 11:45am. We will walk over to the Commons together.
 
There will be a 5-minute grace period for students to arrive for this event at the meeting locations. Please arrive during this time, as the event will begin promptly. Students who arrive after will not be able to attend.
 
If you cannot attend the event after submitting your RSVP, please cancel your reservation to allow other students to participate.
Maximum 2 sign ups per student.  
 
We look forward to dining with you!

From Tuesday, October 1, 2024 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus, Meet in the WellNest (Carmichael Student Ctr, room 261) .

item.title: Be True 2024
item.description:
Be True 2024

Hear ye, hear ye!

Pre-sign up for joining the Royal Court is now open! Use this link to register now: https://forms.office.com/r/mHf1FstmEh Same-day sign-ups are available but will close at 6:30pm on the day of the event. Why wait until the last minute when you can register now?

Join us for our annual Ren Faire-themed , Royal Court in honor of LGTBQ History Month! ✨ Happening on October 1st, from 5-8pm at the Marietta JMW Student Center.

Come dressed in your finest Ren Faire attire, cosplay, or costumes, and enjoy an evening filled with pizza, snacks, games, prizes, and activities from different campus groups. At the end of the night, we will crown the two royals with the most votes!

Activities this year include:

-Cookie Decoration

-Rainbow Mini Putt Putt

-Create a Fairy Garden

-Decorate a Fairy Door

-Write positive notes

-Decorate earrings and key chain

-Create an authentic leadership corkboard 

-Create your own fairy wand and play fairy vs. fairy

 

Don't miss out on this magical event! ✨

Taking exams can be a stressful experience. Many of us experience increased anxiety in the run up to an exam, during an exam time, as well after the exam is finished. This workshop will discuss types of test anxiety and provide tools for combatting it before, during, and after an exam.

item.title: SAFE Class
item.description:
SAFE Class

Self-defense Awareness & Familiarization Exchange is a two hour program offered by the KSU Police for students, faculty and staff at KSU, free of charge. The program is based upon the following ideas: violent crimes are crimes of opportunity, and when you remove the element of opportunity, you reduce the risk of attack. 90% of self-defense is mental preparedness; the other 10% is physical.

S.A.F.E. will provide participants with great crime prevention information and resources as well as a pre-basic familiarization with physical training methods.

From Wednesday, October 2, 2024 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM EDT at University Room B.

item.title: Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)
item.description:
Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery now hosts an on-campus Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA - formerly known as Self-Injury Recovery Anonymous) meeting. This Meeting of SIRA is for people in recovery or seeking recovery. This group is not open to observation or academic credit.

To provide a safe space for individuals who engage in physical self-injury to come together to share experiences, strength, and hope without judgment or criticism. Together, we deepen our understanding of our behaviors and triggers and work within the framework of our program to help ourselves and each other on our path to freedom. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop injuring oneself physically.

From Wednesday, October 2, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6138.

item.title: Women's Climb Night
item.description:
Women's Climb Night

"After feeling intimidated and discouraged while trying rock climbing for the first time, I realized that many women have also had similar experiences. Recognizing that women are under-represented in the climbing community, a group of staff members decided to host an event specifically for women in the Climbing Gym. Since 2019, we have been able to host Women's Climb Night and successfully introduce women to the sport in a supportive and welcoming environment." - Ransley Cummings, Lead Climbing Instructor 

Scheduled monthly, Women's Climb Night offers a supportive environment for female climbers, no matter their skill level.  Shoes, chalk, and harness rentals are complimentary during the event.  We will have extra female staff to help belay and provide climbing instruction/assistance.  The climbing gym will only be available for women during Women's Climb Night. 

From Wednesday, October 2, 2024 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at KSU Climbing Gym.

Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned dancer, you'll learn exciting routines while jamming out to the hottest hits. Join us for a lively workout that focuses on rhythm, expression, and community. Bring your moves, your groove, and a whole lot of energy!

Sponsored by the College of Architecture and Construction Management and Global Education. Hosted by Associate Professor of Architecture Michael Carroll.

This event is part of KSU's focus in 2024-25 on Canada's history, culture, geography, people, and practices. Unique "Year of Canada" merch will be available! Check out all of our events listed in OwlLife and online.

item.title: You Matter Month: Couch Conversations
item.description:
You Matter Month: Couch Conversations

Engaging in lively conversations with others serves as both a form of social interaction and a means to enhance your mental health. Couch Conversations provides participants with opportunities to discuss various topics, from pop culture to sharing personal experiences and emotions. This event is a great way to practice active listening, empathy, and effective communication skills. As we provide space to share thoughts and feelings without judgment, we intend to foster stronger social connections but also gain a sense of belonging and emotional well-being. It's a reminder of the power of human connection and how simple interactions can positively impact mental health. 

From Thursday, October 3, 2024 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus Green AND Marietta Campus The Globe area.

Take the first step towards becoming an informed and active citizen – your voice matters!

Adulting 101 is a monthly workshop series designed to educate students on key life skills to utilize during and after college, with the goal of eliminating informational barriers that may prevent students from reaching degree completion and achieving post-college success. item.description:
Wise Choices Workshop

Designed to educate students in making informed choices about drugs and alcohol, this course is taught on referral from multiple sources; including Student Conduct & Academic Integrity, Department of Fraternity & Sorority Life, Housing & Residence Life, and Department of Athletics. This three-hour workshop is taught by the Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery staff specializing in the field of addiction prevention and education. 


Students who participate in the Wise Choices Workshop will be charged an administrative fee for this class. Your Owl Express account will be assessed the amount of $85.00 after completion of the workshop. This fee must be paid within 30 days to avoid a Bursar's registration hold on your account. You may pay this fee on-line through Owl Express (web-check or credit card) or in person at the Bursar's Office (cash, check or money order). Please wait until you have received an email notification that the charge has been posted before you attempt to pay.

item.title: RIO #1: Recognition, Insight, Openness
item.description:
RIO #1: Recognition, Insight, Openness
Feeling Overwhelmed and looking to get "Unstuck"? 
 
Recognition, Insight, Openness (RIO) is a 3-week, curriculum-driven workshop designed to help students gain insight into their concerns, develop a clear sense of what they would like to change in their lives, and identify tools and concrete strategies to reduce feelings of stress and improve emotional functioning.
 
RIO teaches students techniques for recognizing and moving past situations that cause stress, frustration, and anxiety. 
  • Manage and reduce anxiety.
  • Adapt to new challenges.
  • Understand your thoughts and feelings, WITHOUT judgment or shame.
  • Move beyond feeling “stuck”.
  • Take the initiative to step out of your comfort zone.
RIO #1 will meet in-person for 3 consecutive weeks: Monday, Oct. 7, Oct. 14, and Oct. 21 at 3:00pm.
 

From Monday, October 7, 2024 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus, Bagwell Education, BEB 129.

item.title: Year of Canada: Film Screening: Catwalk: Tales from the Cat Show Circuit
item.description:
Year of Canada: Film Screening: Catwalk: Tales from the Cat Show Circuit

Get your "meow" ready! Join us for a screening of the Canadian documentary film: “Catwalk: Tales from the Canadian Cat Show Circuit” written and directed by Michael McNamara.  
 
Meet the fascinating felines and the people who pamper them in this whimsical look at the ins and outs of Canada’s competitive cat show circuit, where the claws come out when a Turkish Angora and an adorable fluffy red Persian face off to take home the national award for Best in Show. 
 
Following the screening, Director Michael McNamara will talk about the process of shooting, editing and distributing his documentary and his experience of bringing “Catwalk” to the streaming platform, Netflix.

Year of Canada "meow merch" will be put in the paws of those who attend.

Sponsored by Norman J. Radow College of Humanities & Social Sciences and Global Education. Hosted by Assistant Professor of Communication Matthew Terrell.

This event is part of KSU's focus in 2024-25 on Canada's history, culture, geography, people, and practices. Unique "Year of Canada" merch will be available! Check out all of our events listed in OwlLife and online.

From Tuesday, October 8, 2024 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM EDT at Prillaman Hall, Room 1001.

item.title: Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)
item.description:
Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery now hosts an on-campus Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA - formerly known as Self-Injury Recovery Anonymous) meeting. This Meeting of SIRA is for people in recovery or seeking recovery. This group is not open to observation or academic credit.

To provide a safe space for individuals who engage in physical self-injury to come together to share experiences, strength, and hope without judgment or criticism. Together, we deepen our understanding of our behaviors and triggers and work within the framework of our program to help ourselves and each other on our path to freedom. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop injuring oneself physically.

From Wednesday, October 9, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6138.

Title: “TBA”
Abstract: TBA

 

The Ecology, Evolution, Behavior, & Organismal Biology (EEBOB) seminar series focuses on biological topics at whole-organism and higher scales of organization. Guest speakers come from universities, governmental agencies, NGOs, zoos, museums, and other institutions.

 

This seminar series consists of a pre-recorded seminar, which will be posted to a playlist at the beginning of each week, and a live, virtual Q&A session with the speaker. All are welcome to attend! item.title: Visiting Artist Talk: Rhiannon Skye Tafoya
item.description:
Visiting Artist Talk: Rhiannon Skye Tafoya

Rhiannon Skye Tafoya is an interdisciplinary artist from the Eastern Band of Cherokee and the Santa Clara Pueblo Tribes. She earned a BFA in printmaking from the Institute of American Indian Arts in Santa Fe, NM, and an MFA in print media from Pacific Northwest College of Art in Portland, OR. She published her first artist book, Ul’nigid’ in 2020, and has exhibited work nationally and abroad in numerous group and solo exhibitions. She has been an artist-in-residence at notable institutions such as Crow’s Shadow Institute of the Arts (Pendleton, OR) and Kala Art Institute (Berkeley, CA) and University of Iowa Center for the Book (Iowa City, IA.) Her work is housed in many special collections, including the US Library of Congress, Kohler Art Library, the Bainbridge Museum of Art, National Museum of Women in the Arts, and the Museum of the Cherokee People. She currently lives and works in Cherokee, NC. Tafoya will present an artist talk along with a selection of her prints, paper weavings, and artist books for viewing before presenting a demonstration on processes related to her artistic practice. 

From Friday, October 11, 2024 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM EDT at Chastain Pointe (Printmaking Studios).

item.title: Managing Anxiety & Depression
item.description:
Managing Anxiety & Depression

The Managing Anxiety and Depression virtual workshop will be an educational experience with the opportunity to interact with counselor and group members going through similar struggles. Not a therapy group but designed to begin providing you with knowledge in the healing process, awareness about your mood and to begin practicing these skills on your own. We aim to help you understand:

  • Causes and experiences of anxiety and depression
  • Connection between stress and anxiety/depression
  • New approaches to managing anxiety and depression
  • How the mind and body respond to mental distress
The workshop will be hosted virtually on Microsoft Teams. Students who RSVP thru OwlLife will receive a meeting invitation on the day of the workshop.

item.title: Printing Workshop with Rhiannon Skye Tafoya
item.description:
Printing Workshop with Rhiannon Skye Tafoya

****Please note that this workshop requires registration and has a limited capacity. Please RSVP for the workshop using this link. Only those who have RSVP'd will be allowed to participate in the workshop.****

Rhiannon Skye Tafoya is an interdisciplinary indigenous artist from the Eastern Band of Cherokee and the Santa Clara Pueblo Tribes. Influenced by a strong lineage of basket-weavers both paternal and maternal, she continues to use paper-weaving processes to honor her loved ones and ancestors. Her meticulously crafted designs, patterns, prints, and weavings are influenced by basketry and contain themes of cultural teachings, Cherokee language preservation, motherhood and personal and family narratives. Her work is created to archive, preserve and share stories, language, culture, and experiences. Tafoya will present a selection of her prints, paper weavings, and artist books for viewing before conducting a workshop on processes related to her artistic practice. Utilizing the spacious printmaking studios at the School of Art and Design, workshop attendees will explore various relief printing and paper weaving techniques focusing on color, pattern, design and typography.  

From Saturday, October 12, 2024 12:00 PM to 4:00 PM EDT at Chastain Pointe (Printmaking Studios).

item.title: QPR Training
item.description:
QPR Training
QPR (Question, Persuade, Refer) are three simple steps anyone can learn to help save a life from suicide. People trained in QPR learn how to recognize the warning signs of a suicide crisis and how to question, persuade, and refer someone to help. 


The in-person training will be held on the Kennesaw campus. REGISTER by completing the form, Fall 2024 Mental Health Training Registration. Please register no later than one week before the training date. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Chelsea Williams at cwill733@kennesaw.edu. 

 

If your group or department is interested in hosting an in-person training on either campus, please reach out to Chelsea Williams at cwill733@kennesaw.edu for more information.

item.title: RIO #2: Recognition, Insight, Openness
item.description:
RIO #2: Recognition, Insight, Openness
Feeling Overwhelmed and looking to get "Unstuck"? 
 
Recognition, Insight, Openness (RIO) is a 3-week, curriculum-driven workshop designed to help students gain insight into their concerns, develop a clear sense of what they would like to change in their lives, and identify tools and concrete strategies to reduce feelings of stress and improve emotional functioning.
 
RIO teaches students techniques for recognizing and moving past situations that cause stress, frustration, and anxiety. 
  • Manage and reduce anxiety.
  • Adapt to new challenges.
  • Understand your thoughts and feelings, WITHOUT judgment or shame.
  • Move beyond feeling “stuck”.
  • Take the initiative to step out of your comfort zone.
RIO #2 will meet in-person for 3 consecutive weeks: Tuesday, Oct. 15, Oct. 22, and Oct. 29 at 3:00pm.

From Tuesday, October 15, 2024 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus, Bagwell Education, BEB 129.

Each Fall & Spring semester, we invite many of the nation's top companies to the Kennesaw campus in order to showcase KSU's brightest students and alumni for internship, co-op, full-time, & part-time positions.

 

This event is for companies to recruit for jobs and internships in all majors and industries. Don't forget that this is a two-day fair, so be sure to look for which day each company or school will be in attendance, and make plans to attend both days to visit with more companies!

 

  • Business and Humanities are encouraged to attend BOTH days

This fair will be held in person and many companies are recruiting virtually - check Handshake for virtual employer events.

item.title: Naloxone Training
item.description:
Naloxone Training

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery will host training sessions throughout each semester to teach students how to administer Naloxone, a medication that reverses the effects of an opioid overdose.

At the end of this training the participants will be able to:

  1. Identify potential warning signs of an overdose
  2. Operate and administer Naloxone in the event of an overdose
  3. Identify how Naloxone works
  4. Understand the Georgia Medical Amnesty Law
  5. Practice with Naloxone test kits

Each person who attends & completes training is provided a free Naloxone kit. RSVP is required for training.

From Wednesday, October 16, 2024 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6137.

item.title: Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)
item.description:
Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA)

The Center for Young Adult Addiction and Recovery now hosts an on-campus Self-Injury Recovery & Awareness (SIRA - formerly known as Self-Injury Recovery Anonymous) meeting. This Meeting of SIRA is for people in recovery or seeking recovery. This group is not open to observation or academic credit.

To provide a safe space for individuals who engage in physical self-injury to come together to share experiences, strength, and hope without judgment or criticism. Together, we deepen our understanding of our behaviors and triggers and work within the framework of our program to help ourselves and each other on our path to freedom. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop injuring oneself physically.

From Wednesday, October 16, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Kennesaw Campus CYAAR Location - University Village 6000 Building - UV 6138.

Title: “TBA”

The Ecology, Evolution, Behavior, & Organismal Biology (EEBOB) seminar series focuses on biological topics at whole-organism and higher scales of organization. Guest speakers come from universities, governmental agencies, NGOs, zoos, museums, and other institutions.

 

This seminar series consists of a pre-recorded seminar, which will be posted to a playlist at the beginning of each week, and a live, virtual Q&A session with the speaker. All are welcome to attend!
